ground_truth: As Bond walks calmly down the corridor, Greene and his party are hurrying for an exit, and they come face to face. On stage, guns are drawn, and the hero is shot as men chase Bond. He runs through a crowded restaurant, and shots are fired, taking down a bystander. Bond waits in ambush, and a pursuer engages in a gun battle in the restaurant. Bond escapes into the kitchen area, where a man body checks him, but Bond shoots him pointblank through the body. He ducks as a door flies open in front of him and tips over a pan of oil, which bursts into flames, allowing him to get past the gunman as the hero dies bloodily on stage. He marches the man away with a gun at his neck, holding him at the edge of a roof. Greene gets in his car, and Bond's prisoner tries to break free, but Bond sends him off the roof, and he lands on Greene's car. Bond straightens his tuxedo as the grim driver gets out and finishes him. In London, an operator is looking at Bond's photos, and M stares at her screen, registering surprise. He walks pensively away from the desk, then goes back, grins, and walks off. Bond is in the back of a powerboat flying an Italian flag at the stern, heading towards a promontory topped by a grand villa overlooking the turquoise blue sea. Bond approaches a stout wooden door, but she can't walk off, so he drops photos on the table and helps himself to white wine. Bond grins as Mathis looks up at his glamorous younger woman, and Bond drains a glass. In a bar on a plane, he looks at a picture of the dead Vespa, picks up a necklace from the bar, and sips a martini. Mathis joins him, and Bond slips the photo into his pocket as they study one another. Bond stays at the bar, and then he and Mathis move through immigration where a redhead in a raincoat stands waiting. They get in a taxi which drives through the busy downtown traffic and gets down from the taxi as Fields strides into a rundown hotel. Bond heads back to the taxi and she obeys, tight-lipped. The statue of an eagle spreads its wings beneath a blue sky dusted with clouds as they are still bickering and are led through the airy tile and marble halls. Bond casually tosses the keys on a sofa and strides through the spacious, modern furnishings eyed by Fields. She stands looking lost while he casts a critical eye over the bedroom and marble en-suite bathroom. He takes off his jacket, walks into the bathroom, Fields grins, and goes to the bedroom. Bond answers the door naked.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As Bond strides calmly and confidently down the long, narrow corridor, Greene and his party of men, in a frantic rush, are hurrying towards an exit, and they unexpectedly come face to face with Bond. On the main stage, guns are suddenly drawn, and the hero, tragically, is shot as the men continue to chase Bond. In a tense, dramatic moment, he races through a crowded and bustling restaurant, and amid the chaos, shots are fired, tragically taking down an innocent bystander. Bond waits patiently in ambush, cleverly planning his next move, while a determined pursuer engages in a fierce gun battle right there in the restaurant. Bond makes a daring escape into the kitchen area, where a man aggressively body checks him. However, Bond manages to shoot him at point-blank range, the bullet piercing through the man's body. He skillfully ducks as a door unexpectedly flies open right in front of him and deftly tips over a pan of hot oil, which bursts dramatically into flames, creating a fiery distraction that allows him to slip past the persistent gunman as the hero dies bloodily and tragically on stage. He then confidently marches his captive away with a gun held threateningly at the man's neck, holding him precariously at the very edge of a roof. Greene hastily gets into his car, and Bond's prisoner desperately attempts to break free from Bond's grip, but Bond sends him tumbling off the roof, and he crashes onto Greene's car below. Bond, with a sense of calm composure, straightens his tuxedo as the grim-faced driver steps out and finishes the job. Meanwhile, back in London, an operator is intently looking at Bond's photos, and M stands staring at her screen, registering surprised disbelief. He walks pensively away from the desk, reflecting on the situation, then suddenly goes back, grins mischievously, and confidently walks off. Bond is then seen in the back of a powerboat, which is proudly flying an Italian flag at the stern, heading purposefully towards a scenic promontory topped by a grand, elegant villa that overlooks the breathtaking turquoise blue sea. As Bond approaches a stout wooden door, she finds she can't walk off, so he casually drops photos on the table and then helps himself to a glass of crisp white wine. Bond grins broadly as Mathis looks up at his glamorous, younger female companion, and Bond swiftly drains his glass. Later, in a bar on a plane, he looks thoughtfully at a picture of the deceased Vespa, picks up a delicate necklace from the bar, and takes a long sip of his expertly prepared martini. Mathis eventually joins him, and Bond discreetly slips the photo into his pocket as they study and assess each other intently. Bond remains at the bar for a moment longer, and then he and Mathis make their way through immigration, where a redhead clad in a raincoat is standing patiently, waiting. They get into a taxi, which carefully navigates through the busy downtown traffic, and then they alight from the taxi as Fields strides purposefully into a rundown, shabby hotel. Bond heads back to the taxi, and she follows obediently, albeit tight-lipped. A majestic statue of an eagle spreads its grand wings beneath a vibrant blue sky dusted with fluffy clouds as they continue their bickering and are led through airy tile and marble halls. Bond casually tosses the keys onto a plush sofa and confidently strides through the spacious room, with its modern furnishings eyed with interest by Fields. She stands looking somewhat lost while he casts a critical and discerning eye over the elegantly appointed bedroom and luxurious marble en-suite bathroom. He casually removes his jacket, walks into the bathroom, and then Fields grins playfully as she heads to the bedroom. Bond, in a bold and unselfconscious move, answers the door completely naked.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Bond moves with a calm and composed demeanor down the corridor, Greene and his entourage are in a hurry, making their way toward an exit until they suddenly find themselves directly in front of Bond. On stage, the tension escalates as guns are drawn, and amidst the chaos, the hero is shot while several men initiate a pursuit after Bond. He swiftly navigates through the crowded restaurant, where the high-stakes chase results in gunfire that tragically claims the life of a bystander. Bond strategically positions himself in ambush as one of his pursuers engages him in a gun battle amidst the restaurant's commotion. Seizing an opportunity to escape, Bond darts into the kitchen area, where a confrontation ensues with a man who body checks him, only for Bond to respond by firing a shot through the man's body. As he advances, he ducks swiftly to avoid a door that swings open in front of him and, in his quick thinking, tips over a pan of oil, igniting it into flames that provide a diversion. This fiery obstacle allows Bond to outmaneuver the gunman while, on stage, the hero succumbs to his bloody fate. Bond takes charge of the situation by marching a captive away with a gun pressed to the man's neck, bringing him to the edge of a rooftop. As Greene makes his escape in a car, Bond's prisoner attempts a daring escape himself, only to be sent over the roof's edge by Bond, landing on Greene's car in a dramatic fall. With a sense of composure, Bond straightens his tuxedo as the grim driver emerges to finish his task. Meanwhile, in London, an operator examines Bond's photos on her screen, leading to M registering surprise at the images before her. Bond exhibits a thoughtful pause as he walks slowly away from the desk, only to return, flash a grin, and then walk confidently away. Transitioning scenes, Bond is now situated in the back of a powerboat adorned with an Italian flag at the stern, as it speeds towards a scenic promontory crowned by a grand villa overlooking the strikingly turquoise sea. Bond approaches a substantial wooden door but is unable to proceed further, prompting him to casually place photos on a table and indulge in a glass of white wine. He shares a knowing grin with Mathis, who gazes at his glamorous younger companion, while Bond finishes the wine. Aboard a plane's bar, Bond reflects on a picture of the deceased Vespa, and in a moment tinged with nostalgia, he picks up a necklace from the bar and takes a measured sip of his martini. As Mathis joins him, Bond discreetly slips the photo into his pocket, and they exchange studious glances. Remaining at the bar, Bond eventually joins Mathis as they navigate through immigration, where a redhead in a raincoat waits expectantly. They climb into a taxi, which weaves through the bustling downtown traffic before they alight, following Fields into a rundown hotel. Bond decisively returns to the taxi, leading to Fields' reluctant compliance as she follows, tight-lipped. Beneath a blue sky adorned with clouds, an eagle statue majestically spreads its wings as Bond and Fields continue their heated exchange, eventually being ushered through the airy, tile-and-marble-adorned halls. Bond nonchalantly tosses the keys onto a sofa before confidently striding through a room replete with spacious and modern furnishings that capture Fields' curiosity. As she stands feeling somewhat directionless, Bond appraises the bedroom and the adjoining marble en-suite bathroom with a critical eye. He removes his jacket, making his way into the bathroom, prompting Fields to grin as she heads to the bedroom. In a moment of boldness, Bond answers the door without a stitch of clothing.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
As Bond calmly walks down the corridor, he encounters Greene and his party rushing for an exit. Guns are drawn on stage, and the hero is fatally shot. Bond sprints through a crowded restaurant amidst gunfire, resulting in a bystander's injury. He ambushes a pursuer and flees to the kitchen, where he shoots a man after being body checked. After a fiery distraction allows him to evade another gunman, Bond captures a man and holds him at gunpoint on a rooftop edge. As Greene drives away, Bond sends his prisoner off the roof, who lands on Greene's car before Bond adjusts his tuxedo.

In London, M is surprised to see Bond's photos on her screen. Bond paces pensively, then returns to the desk with a grin and walks away. Later, he is in a powerboat heading towards a villa on a promontory. Upon arrival, he drops photos on a table, helps himself to wine, and shares a moment with Mathis and a younger woman before draining his glass. On a plane, Bond looks at a picture of the deceased Vespa, picks up a necklace, and sips a martini. Mathis joins him, and Bond discreetly pockets the photo as they assess each other.

Bond remains at the bar, then moves through immigration with Mathis, where they meet a redhead in a raincoat. They take a taxi through busy downtown traffic and arrive at a rundown hotel, where Fields enters. Bond returns to the taxi, and Fields, after a brief argument, follows. An eagle statue stands beneath a blue sky as they are led through grand halls. Bond throws the keys onto a sofa, surveys the modern furnishings, and evaluates the bedroom and en-suite bathroom. He removes his jacket, heads to the bathroom, and Fields heads to the bedroom, grinning. Bond answers the door unclothed.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: As Bond, the legendary British spy known for his calm demeanor, walks calmly down the corridor, Greene, a notorious environmentalist villain with dubious intentions, and his party are hurrying for an exit, and they come face to face. On stage, guns are drawn, and the hero, likely a key figure in Greene's plot, is shot as men chase Bond. He runs through a crowded restaurant in a bustling European city known for its culinary delights, and shots are fired, taking down a bystander. Bond waits in ambush, reminiscent of his tactical training in MI6, and a pursuer engages in a gun battle in the restaurant. Bond escapes into the kitchen area, where a man body checks him, a technique possibly learned in military combat, but Bond shoots him pointblank through the body. He ducks as a door flies open in front of him and tips over a pan of oil, which bursts into flames, creating a fiery distraction, allowing him to get past the gunman as the hero dies bloodily on stage. He marches the man away with a gun at his neck, holding him at the edge of a roof reminiscent of classic spy thrillers. Greene gets in his car, a sleek vehicle befitting a villain of his status, and Bond's prisoner tries to break free, but Bond sends him off the roof, and he lands on Greene's car with a loud thud. Bond straightens his tuxedo with the nonchalance of a seasoned spy as the grim driver gets out and finishes him. In London, the epicenter of global intelligence operations, an operator is looking at Bond's photos, and M, the head of MI6, stares at her screen, registering surprise. He walks pensively away from the desk, then goes back, grins, and walks off. Bond is in the back of a powerboat flying an Italian flag at the stern, headed towards a picturesque Mediterranean promontory topped by a grand villa overlooking the turquoise blue sea. Bond approaches a stout wooden door, but she can't walk off, so he drops photos on the table and helps himself to white wine, an Italian vintage renowned in the region. Bond grins as Mathis, an old ally with a complex history, looks up at his glamorous younger woman, and Bond drains a glass. In a bar on a plane, he looks at a picture of the dead Vespa, an unresolved chapter in his life, picks up a necklace from the bar, and sips a martini, famously shaken not stirred. Mathis joins him, and Bond slips the photo into his pocket as they study one another. Bond stays at the bar, and then he and Mathis move through immigration where a redhead in a raincoat, possibly a covert contact, stands waiting. They get in a taxi which drives through the busy downtown traffic of a city known for its chaotic streets and gets down from the taxi as Fields, a fellow agent, strides into a rundown hotel. Bond heads back to the taxi and she obeys, tight-lipped, aware of the risks involved. The statue of an eagle, symbolizing power and freedom, spreads its wings beneath a blue sky dusted with clouds as they are still bickering and are led through the airy tile and marble halls, reminiscent of a grand yet secretive government building. Bond casually tosses the keys on a sofa and strides through the spacious, modern furnishings eyed by Fields. She stands looking lost while he casts a critical eye over the bedroom and marble en-suite bathroom, a mark of his discerning taste. He takes off his jacket, walks into the bathroom, Fields grins, and goes to the bedroom. Bond answers the door naked, confident in his vulnerability, a hallmark of his character.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. Bond grins as Mathis looks up at his glamorous younger woman and Bond drains a glass. In a bar on a plane he looks at a picture of the dead. Vespa picks up a necklace from the bar and sips a martini. Mathis joins him and Bond slips the photo into his pocket as they study one another. Bond stays at the bar and then he and Mathis move through immigration where a redhead in a raincoat stands waiting. They get in a taxi which drives through the busy downtown traffic and gets down from the taxi as Fields strides into a rundown hotel. Bond heads back to the taxi and she obeys tightlipped. The statue of an eagle spreads its wings beneath a blue sky dusted with clouds as they are still bickering and are led through the airy tile and marble halls. Bond casually tosses the keys on a sofa and strides through the spacious modern furnishings eyed by Fields. She stands looking lost while he casts a critical eye over the bedroom and marble ensuite bathroom. He takes off his jacket walks into the bathroom. Fields grins and goes to the bedroom. Bond answers the door naked.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: As Bond strolls indifferently down the corridor, Greene and his party are drifting toward an exit, and they bump into each other. On stage, guns are waved, and the hero is applauded as men trail Bond. He skips through a crowded restaurant and glasses are broken, startling a bystander. Bond hides behind a column, and a pursuer participates in a dance in the restaurant. Bond maneuvers into the kitchen area, where a man high-fives him, but Bond ignores him completely. He crouches as a door swings open in front of him and slides under a table, which shatters into pieces, allowing him to slip past the gunman as the hero bows dramatically on stage. He escorts the man away with a hand on his shoulder, holding him at the edge of a roof. Greene sits in his car, and Bond's prisoner attempts to negotiate, but Bond drops him from the roof, and he bounces off Greene's car. Bond adjusts his cufflinks as the desolate driver gets out and salutes him. In London, an operator is shuffling Bond's photos, and M glances at her screen, exhibited bemusement. He wanders thoughtfully away from the desk, then pauses, smirks, and resumes walking. Bond nears a sturdy wooden door, but she can't sit still, so he scatters photos on the table and pours himself white wine. Bond chuckles as Mathis glances up at his glamorous younger woman, and Bond fills a glass. In a bar on a plane, he examines a picture of the late Vespa, retrieves a necklace from the bar, and tastes a martini. Mathis approaches him, and Bond tucks the photo into his pocket as they assess one another. Bond lingers at the bar, and then he and Mathis pass through customs where a redhead in a raincoat stands waiting. They get into a taxi which navigates through the busy downtown traffic and exits the taxi as Fields ambles into a rundown hotel. Bond heads over to the taxi and she complies, stone-faced. The statue of an eagle stretches its wings beneath a blue sky brushed with clouds as they continue debating and are escorted through the airy tile and marble halls. Bond casually tosses the keys on a sofa and wanders through the spacious, modern furnishings eyed by Fields. She stands appearing puzzled while he casts an evaluating eye over the bedroom and marble en-suite bathroom. He removes his jacket, strolls into the bathroom, Fields chuckles, and heads to the bedroom. Bond greets the door shirtless.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: As Bond calmly walks down the corridor, he encounters Greene and his party trying to flee. Guns are drawn, and a hero on stage is shot. Bond runs through a busy restaurant, engages in a gunfight, and escapes to the kitchen. There, he shoots a man, causing a fiery distraction with spilled oil. Bond captures a pursuer, marches him to a rooftop, and throws him onto Greene's car below. In London, M is surprised by Bond's photos as Bond walks away with a grin. Bond, on a powerboat, approaches a villa and drops photos on a table, sharing wine with Mathis. Later, in a plane bar, he looks at a picture of Vespa and sips a martini. Bond and Mathis then move through immigration, meet a redhead, and are driven to a rundown hotel with Fields. Bond inspects the modern furnishings and bathroom, amusing Fields, before answering the door unclothed.

dead Bond grins as Mathis looks up at his glamorous younger woman and Bond drains a glass Bond approaches a stout wooden door but she cannot walk off so he drops photos on the table and helps himself to white wine Bond is in the back of a powerboat flying an Italian flag at the stern heading towards a promontory topped by a grand villa overlooking the turquoise blue sea He walks pensively away from the desk then goes back grins and walks off In London an operator is looking at Bond's photos and M stares at her screen registering surprise Bond straightens his tuxedo as the grim driver gets out and finishes him Greene gets in his car and Bond's prisoner tries to break free but Bond sends him off the roof and he lands on Greene's car He marches the man away with a gun at his neck holding him at the edge of a roof He ducks as a door flies open in front of him and tips over a pan of oil which bursts into flames allowing him to get past the gunman as the hero dies bloodily on stage Bond escapes into the kitchen area where a man body checks him but Bond shoots him pointblank through the body Bond waits in ambush and a pursuer engages in a gun battle in the restaurant He runs through a
